video.title: Azure Administrator Certification (AZ-104) - Full Course to PASS the Exam
video.description:
The Azure Administrator is the most popular Azure certification because it provides the broadest amount of practical knowledge to manage Azure infrastructure and it allows you to pivot into any career path for Azure-based roles. By the end of this full course taught by an expert trainer, you will be ready to take the exam for the Azure Administrator Certification - and pass!

✏️ Course developed by Andrew Brown of ExamPro. Check out the ExamPro YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/ExamProChannel
🔗 ExamPro Cloud Obsessed Certification Training: https://www.exampro.co

topLevelComment.author: David Ribeiro
topLevelComment.text:
I passed my exam today (19/sep/2022). Here's a lot of information you may find interesting: 

- This is a nice course for you to learn how to do stuff in Azure and some theory. It helped me a lot in the exam, but I would probably have failed if I have only used this to study.  Andrew is not to be blamed either! The exam is just a bit bizarre. Tricky questions, strangely worded descriptions, long case studies that you can waste several minutes reading when it is not really necessary.

- I strongly recommend Udemy's "AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator Practice Tests 2022" from Cloud Connect. I don't know if they sneaked a camera into the exam or what, but the questions are THE SAME as the IRL exam. Those practice exams carried me through my certification.  Memorize the answers from those tests and you're set!  Their explanations SUCK though. Stick to Andrew's content for that.

- I got 50% off the exam for completing the "30 Days to Learn It!"  learning path from Microsoft (google it!). You subscribe, skip to the last 10 seconds of each lecture to mark them as completed, answer whatever on the knowledge tests (you need to complete it, not pass it) and at the end you get a voucher.  It takes a while (1,5 hour, maybe?) but hey... 50% off is A LOT in my local currency.

-My exam had 49 questions, awkwardly divided and badly explained:   33 regular questions (multiple choice, multiple answers, true/false, etc); 10 "same scenario" questions divided in 3 scenarios; and 6 "case study" questions, all of them for the same case study.   All of that in 100 minutes (1 hour and 40 minutes).   That is not even CLOSE to the number of questions OR duration I read was expected for the AZ-104. Looks like each person's test is different.   One reason why I think I only got 49 questions is that a lot of questions expected 2 or 3 answers, each worth one point.  

- My progress meter was a mess. it showed "X out of 49" where X = (1 to 43)  for the regular questions.... then it reset to "1 out of 49" for the last part (case study) and went from 1 to 6.  If the meter doesn't make sense just ignore it and focus on the time left. I would leave 25 min for each case study.

- "Same Scenario" questions are questions that have the same exact description but different answers in each. For instance: the description says you want to accomplish something in Azure. The 1st question asks how to do it in PowerShell, the 2nd in CLI, and the 3rd using the portal.  The catch is that once you answer a question you cannot go back! So if the 3rd question solves the 1st you cannot go back and fix it. The trick is learning to let go. If you find out you goofed the first ones, just ease your mind and carry on. I got 3 scenarios:  3 questions for scenario A, 3 questions for scenario B and 4 questions for scenario C.

- "Case Study" is quite stupid, imho. They give you an ungodly amount of information for a fake company (Overview, Existing Environment, Planned Changes and Technical Requirements) that you are supposed to read and understand before answering the questions. The problem is that once you memorize all that and go to the questions, they: 1) are basic af,  2) use 10% of the info provided.  My suggestion: Ignore the information and go straight to the question.  Find out what they want you to answer and THEN go back to the documentation. That way you can filter only what you need from the text.  If I've tried to make sense of the text before I went to the questions, I would have ran out of time. 

- I can't prove it and I know it sounds stupid, but I honestly think the small assessment at the begining of the test where they ask you how knowledgeable you are in each topic changes the pool of questions they draw yours from. I answered "I can do stuff guided by an instructor or detailed instructions" for each topic (which I believe is one above "I have no idea what I am doing" or something) and I got 1 case study. My friend was not as modest and got 3 case studies! We had the same difficulty difference on the AZ-900 exam.  I may need a tin foil hat, but it didn't hurt me to be humble yet.


Good luck!!

topLevelComment.author: Jacmac
topLevelComment.text: 10:56:00 What they are saying with the NSG security rule evaluation by priority is that the rule would be satisfied in a priority order. 1]source 2]source port 3] destination 4] destination port 5] protocol means that once 1,2,3,4, or 5 are not satisfied, rule processing for that rule is ended. So if the conditions for the rule break on 1] source, then 2,3,4,5 aren't even going to be looked at. It's just a thing to know, not really critical for rule development, but it might help make some decisions about setting up the rules.

topLevelComment.author: N W
topLevelComment.text: hey guys, just curious do I need to know all the technical deployment and manipulation to pass the exam?

replies.author: Jacmac
replies.text: @N W With no practical usage of the Azure Portal and the associated tools, you would find it very difficult to pass. I won't say impossible, but it would require a very good memory and understanding just from reading and watching the videos. Microsoft Learn has some online self-learning courses that will give you the ability to work with Azure Portal for limited times and functions.

replies.author: N W
replies.text: @Jacmac many thanks for your detail information Jacmac, I am ready to take the sc-900 exam soon. However I don’t have any experience in azure deployment or any technical work. So I’m curious if that will be kind of impossible to study and get pass the exam. (It’s very frustrating watching those practices without azure deployment experiences). And I want to focus more on security part. What I found on the internet mentioned it is recommended to take az-104 first after sc-900

replies.author: Jacmac
replies.text: Yes. I don't know if you have ever taken a Microsoft exam before, but all of them pretty much rely on you having an practical working knowledge of the subject matter, including hands-on deployment, hand-on configuration, hand-on modification, etc. Understanding the concepts alone will not get you a pass, and you will not guess your way through many of the questions (maybe a small percentage you can guess successfully). Definitely do all of the practice exams you can get your hands on to get a good idea what the exam will be like.

topLevelComment.author: Joe B
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for sharing this content. One note, on a Linux system, the & is a signification that you want to fork a process, so in your example where you are showing (3:22:40) the done. done. done. it was telling you it was done setting ss=b and so on. The & in your string are forks (aka additional commands to be processed from the shell in the background). This has nothing to do with the Azcopy command. If you had double quotes around the entire command (as you did in your successful attempt on a Windows box) it would have been successful. Just thought I would mention it since a fair amount of strings for URLs have such (among others) in them to be passed via API.  Thanks

topLevelComment.author: SCC Francisco Bustos
topLevelComment.text:
1:04:55 Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (MECM) is what used to be called SCCM, a device inventory and management tool. Microsoft created its own "Endpoint" suite called "Microsoft Endpoint Manager", which is an umbrella covering, among others, MECM and Intune. MECM is Microsoft's traditional way of managing devices, especially on-prem. Intune will probably end up replacing MECM because seems that Microsoft doesn't want companies to run any management tool on-prem. It's a matter of time. Maybe MECM would remain to manage those devices (servers and workstations) that somehow cannot be managed by Intune.
Thanks Andrew by this free course

topLevelComment.author: USKAPYAAR
topLevelComment.text: what is OEM ?

replies.author: USKAPYAAR
replies.text: @Doug Champion thanks for the explanation mate.

replies.author: Doug Champion
replies.text: Original Equipment Manufacturer. If you buy an OEM part for your car it's the exact same part made by the same company that the car came with new. If you buy an off brand (often cheaper or sometimes "performance") it's not OEM. Same applies to computers. OEM means the original thing it came with from the factory, out of the box or in it's default configuration.

replies.text:
ORAÇÕES A SANTA FILOMENA

COROINHA DE SANTA FILOMENA

Reza-se assim: 1 Credo... (na Medalha).

3 Pai-Nossos (nas contas brancas) Em honra da Santíssima Trindade, por Cuja glória Santa Filomena deu a vida.

13 Ave-Marias (nas contas Vermelhas) em louvor dos 13 anos em que viveu na terra a Virgem Mártir.

A cada Ave-Maria acrescenta-se a Jaculatória:

Santa Filomena, pelo sangue que derramastes por amor a Jesus Cristo, alcançai-me a graça que vos peço.
Ou:
Santa Filomena, pelo Vosso Amor por Jesus e Maria, rogai por nós.

Por fim: Oração a Santa Filomena:

Ó gloriosa Princesa da Corte Celestial, Santa Filomena, prostrado diante de Vós, rememorando as vossas virtudes
E prodígios, minha alma engrandece
Ao Senhor que operou em vós
Tamanha maravilha de santidade.
Querida Protetora venha em meu
Auxílio para conduzir-me pelos
Caminhos da virtude, para ser minha
Fortaleza em face do inimigo infernal,
Para me trazer do Coração de Jesus a
Riqueza dos auxílios divinos que são
Para este devoto a saúde, a paz do
Coração, a solução de minhas
Dificuldades, o bem-estar de minha
Família, a consciência perfeita, fé, esperança, caridade e o consolo em toda tribulação.
Milagrosa Santa Filomena, em Vós confio! Amém.
Salve Rainha.

Salve, Rainha, Mãe de misericórdia, vida, doçura e esperança nossa, salve!
A vós bradamos os degredados filhos de Eva.
A vós suspiramos, gemendo e chorando neste vale de lágrimas.
Eia, pois, advogada nossa, esses vossos olhos misericordiosos a nós volvei,
E depois deste desterro mostrai-nos Jesus, bendito fruto do vosso ventre,
Ó clemente, ó piedosa, ó doce e sempre Virgem Maria.
Rogai por nós, Santa Mãe de Deus,
Para que sejamos dignos das promessas de Cristo.
Amém.

CONSAGRAÇÃO A SANTA
FILOMENA COMO PADROEIRA
PARTICULAR

Ó gloriosa Santa Filomena, Virgem,
Mártir, esposa de Cristo, glória da
Igreja Católica, ilustre feitora de
Maravilhas.
Eu, vosso indigno servo e protegido,
Consagro-me neste dia por toda a
Minha vida ao vosso amor e à vossa
Devoção.
Sim, eu vos amarei afetuosamente
Sempre, e, depois de Jesus, Maria e
José, carregar-vos-ei em meus
Pensamentos, e falarei de vós a todos
Aos que poderei levar a vos amar e a
Devotarem-se a vós.
Vós sereis, após Jesus, Maria e José,
O objeto de minha afeição, minha
Alegria e minha consolação.
A vós, como a uma íntima e querida
Amiga, manifestarei minhas alegrias;
De vós, procurarei conselho para
Minhas dúvidas, e a vós recorrerei por
Conforto e auxílio em minhas
Provações e tristezas.
Dignai-vos, ó gloriosa Santa, receber-me entre o número de vossos
Protegidos e amantes, e defendei-me a
Todo o tempo.
Ó minha doce Santa, querida Santa
Filomena, eu ofereço e consagro meu
Coração a vós hoje.
Desejo-vos todo bem e alegria, na
Medida em que possa eu também
Contribuir para vossa fortuita glória.
Em contrapartida, perdoai-me por
Minha ousadia, querei-me bem para
Que possa ser estabelecida entre vós e
Eu uma corrente de afeição e amizade
Calorosa e eterna.
Eu jamais vos esquecerei, minha doce
Advogada, e peço que vos lembreis de
Mim para que possa ser vosso
Companheiro pela eternidade no
Paraíso. Amém.

ATO DE CONSAGRAÇÃO A SANTA
FILOMENA

Ilustre Virgem e Mártir Santa Filomena,
Cujo nome e milagres são conhecidos
Até os confins da terra.
Misericordiosamente deposito minha
Confiança em vossa intercessão e
Recomendo vossa especial proteção a
Minha família.
Obtenha-me a saúde da alma e do
Corpo, pois nestes dias tenho
Necessidade de ambas.
Faça-me forte na palavra e no trabalho,
Para que todo pensamento, palavra e
Ação de minha vida procure a glória do
Sagrado Coração de Jesus.
Santa Filomena, rogai por nós. (3x)

ORAÇÃO PARA ESCOLHER
SANTA FILOMENA POR
ADVOGADA

Ó castíssima virgem, ó invicta mártir de
Jesus Cristo como Ele flagelada pelos
Algozes.
Santa Filomena, eis-me prostrado de
Corpo e alma diante de vós, a quem
Escolho para minha amorosa
Advogada, para que eu seja digno de
Vossa intercessão junto do Altíssimo,
Para meu proveito espiritual e
Temporal.
Bem sei que gozais do mais alto favor
Junto a Deus.
A Virgem Santíssima, faz com que
Nada vos seja negado, nenhuma graça
Que lhe pedis como o provam os inumeráveis prodígios que se operam
continuamente pelo Onipotente e
Misericordioso Deus por toda parte,
onde se acrescenta o vosso santo
nome Filomena.
Ele, por sua sapientíssima providência
vos escolheu para ser a nossa
esperança, nosso refúgio e auxílio nas
horas de aflição e desespero.
Vós sois o nosso socorro neste século
atribulado.
Bendigo e glorifico ao Senhor pela
glória e poder com que hoje vos coroa.
Protegei-me, minha amada, santinha e
fazei-me sentir os efeitos da vossa
imensa caridade, alcançando-me a
graça que com tanta urgência
necessito....
Ó Deus, sede eternamente louvado e
bendito em Vossos Santos.
Santa Filomena, valei-me. Amém.
Pai Nosso e Ave Maria, em honra do
sangue da Mártir.

LADAINHA A SANTA
FILOMENA

Composta pelo Cura d’Ars, São João
Batista Maria Vianney
Senhor, tende piedade de nós.
Jesus Cristo, tende piedade de nós.
Senhor, tende piedade de nós.
Jesus Cristo, ouvi-nos.
Jesus Cristo, atendei-nos.
Pai Celeste, que sois Deus, tende
Piedade de nós.
Filho de Deus, Redentor do Mundo que
Sois Deus, tende piedade de nós.
Espírito Santo, que sois Deus, tende
Piedade de nós.
Trindade Santa, que sois um só Deus,
Tende piedade de nós.
Santa Maria, Rainha das Virgens,
Rogai por nós.
Santa Filomena, cheia de abundantes

Santa Filomena, fiel imitadora de

@Salute_vet22 I started by taking some notes on my computer, but soon realized I wasn't benefiting as much study-wise as I'd like from taking these notes. When I watched the course and I didn't fully understand the subject that they were teaching, I did some research on my own (mostly on docs.microsoft).

If you know you're benefiting from taking notes (if that means on the computer or on paper), then I'd encourage you to do so. :)

While its been 5 months since I've watched this video I do remember it explaining in detail on topics that are in the AZ-104 skills outline - both in theory and practical. Imo. none of the exams covers enough to fully prepare you as a whole for doing practical tasks in a real environment, but it will teach you where to start when implementing solutions mentioned in this exam. :)

topLevelComment.author: hashish2007
topLevelComment.text: At 3:29:57 you open tcp/445 as INBOUND port to the machine. It makes no sense as the storage account doesn't initiate any connections TO the machine (you were probably thinking about FTP without passive mode).

topLevelComment.author: hashish2007
topLevelComment.text: Azcopy worked with windows version because you finally wrapped your storage account URL in quotes. In Bash "&" means "send the command to execute in background". So your SAS URL "azcopy cp http://sas.url?blah=yada&dude=cool&stuff=ossom" has been interpreted as: run "azopy sp http://sas.url?blah=yada" in background, then run "dude=cool" also in background, then run "stuff=ossom" in a third background process. The output you saw (numerous "Done" and "Stopped") was from bg/jobs, not from azcopy.
